Question.Text: A 42-Year-Old British Man Living in Malawi With a florid itchy rash, difficulty in breathing. After being bitten by a tick he noticed a circumscribed, painless, indurated lesion on the inside of his left ankle and this was accompanied by fever and arthralgia. On the day of admission, he developed a widespread itchy rash and shortly afterwards became progressively unable to breathe and felt faint. There was a family history of allergy.
